summary: Mexican transnational criminal networks supply fentanyl and methamphetamine to the U.S., fueling a synthetic drug crisis and contributing to hundreds of thousands of overdose deaths in the last 5 years. Efforts to combat these activities include federal agency coordination and information sharing with state, local, and international partners through task forces and other means. Stock photo of a pile of cash with an assortment of...
title: Illicit Synthetic Drugs: Trafficking Methods, Money Laundering Practices, and Coordination Efforts
